description: Display of new illuminated shopfront fascia sign, non illuminated projecting sign and erection of new canvas awning.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be commenced within 3 years from the date of this decision.Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act, 1990.  (As amended)

The facing materials to be used shall be those specified on the application form and approved drawings or such other materials as have been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced and shall thereafter be retained as such.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy BE17 (Signs and Advertisements) of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Unitary Development Plan First Alternation.

Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No advertisement to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to -(a)	endanger persons using any highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military);(b)	obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air; or(c)	hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The intensity of the illumination of the  shopfront fascia sign hereby permitted shall be no greater than 500 cd/m.Reason 1: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.Reason 2: Reason:  In the interests of amenity, the free flow of traffic on the highway and road safety in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The illuminated fascia sign hereby permitted shall be switched off no later than 10.00pm on Mondays to Saturdays and 5.30pm on Sundays and not switched on again until 7.30am Mondays to Saturdays and 11.00am on Sundays.Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
For clarity this permission does not relate to the replacement shopfront detailed in planning application 19/00162/FUL.Reason:  For avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The removal is acceptable given that the tree is not really visible to the public and is causing property damage through root growth.Recommendation:No objections.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:No profesional evidence has been provided to demonstrate that the tree is the cause of the property damage.Recommendation:Refuse .
Trees subject to the application are not protected and are exempt from application as such. App withdrawn with consent of agent.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Appropriate works in keeping with size and age of tree to reduce the crown and thereby it's impact upon the adjacent property.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The Himalayan Birch should not be reduced as this will not be beneficial to its health while the Silver Birch to the rear is already showing signs of decline and should be reduced for health and safety reasons. The Conifer is exempt and not covered by the TPO.Recommendation:Consent for lesser works as follows: T.2 Silver Birch - 30% Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points and remove all ivy.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Appropriate works to reduce and maintain the tree so as to prevent failure in winter storms and reduce risk of limb strike from buses.Recommendation:Approve.
